meanings.def: to mix two or more substances together
examples: blend A with B Blend the flour with the milk to make a smooth paste.
blend A and B (together) Blend together the eggs, sugar and flour.
Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
Oil and water do not mix.
She stirred her tea.
Blend the flour with the milk to make a smooth paste.
Add the fruit and cream and blend well.
I have very little idea of how to blend colours.
Blend all the ingredients together.

meanings.def: to form a mixture with something
examples: blend with something Oil does not blend with water.
blend (together) Oil and water do not blend.

meanings.def: to combine with something in an attractive or effective way; to combine something in this way
examples: blend (something) (together) The old and new buildings blend together perfectly.
blend something (and/with something) Their music blends traditional and modern styles.
This process allows the flavours to blend together.
The ornamental pool blends perfectly with its surroundings.

meanings.def: to produce something by mixing different types together
examples: blended whisky/tea

meanings.def: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide

idioms.def: to behave in a way that does not attract any attention; to disappear or hide

meanings.def: a mixture of different types of the same thing
examples: a blend of tea
The barman prepared a cool blend of tropical fruit juices.
We offer several different blends of freshly ground coffee.
a scarf with a subtle blend of colours

meanings.def: a pleasant or useful combination of different things
examples: a blend of youth and experience
just the right blend of work and relaxation
This charming hotel is a delightful blend of the old and the new.
